tweet: Wishing a happy new year to everyone in Indianapolis and around the world celebrating #RoshHashanah! May this special commemoration bring you joy, fellowship, and optimism for the year ahead. pic.twitter.com/uDBKsZVloo
This week has been historic. Check out my latest e-newsletter for a recap of my work in Washington: https://iqconnect.lmhostediq.com/iqextranet/view_newsletter.aspx?id=101695&c=IN07Carson …

I just voted to terminate President Trump's Border Emergency. 

This #FakeEmergency is nothing but a scheme to build his ineffective wall by diverting money from important military projects. It's not only xenophobic, it's fiscally irresponsible and an insult to our troops.

We must not forget that while #Trump distracts with spin and gaslighting about the #whistleblower investigation, he also is continuing his assault on other American values. We must remain vigilant to fight back on all fronts. https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1177336302863339523 …

The @FAANews must deliver on the intent of Congress and issue a rule mandating the installation of secondary flight deck barriers.

 https://bit.ly/2mYeR38

The FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 called for the @FAANews to mandate #secondarybarriers on all newly manufactured passenger aircraft by October 5, but delay tactics threaten to stall these security enhancements for passengers, crew and the flying public.

At our @HouseIntel hearing, I questioned Acting DNI Joseph Maguire about the need to submit whistleblower complaints to Congress, as the law clearly states. This disregard for the law is one of the most startling aspects of this story, and it can't happen again. Watch: pic.twitter.com/fh9A5wXYKc

That's why our @HouseIntel hearing today is so important. Read the complaint here:

 https://intelligence.house.gov/uploadedfiles/20190812_-_whistleblower_complaint_unclass.pdf …

Now that the whistleblower's complaint has been released, all Americans can see in plain view the extent of the Administration's wrongdoing. What's written can't be muddied by gaslighting, false equivalencies, or spin from the President and his allies. The abuse is clear as day.

I spoke on the House floor urging my colleagues to support a resolution demanding the Trump Administration release the #whistleblower complaint to Congress. This isn't just about protecting our national security. It's about ensuring this President is not above the law. pic.twitter.com/phw2BjFRET

Attention students! My office is now accepting applications for service academy nominations. Now is your opportunity to answer the call to serve our country through attending one of these elite schools. The deadline is October 1. More details here:  https://carson.house.gov/help-from-andre/military-academy-nominations … pic.twitter.com/aBLq1YPFpL

Your vote is your voice, and #NationalVoterRegistrationDay is a great reminder to register to vote so you can speak out fully in our Democracy. I'll continue working in Congress to protect the security of our elections, and push back against #VoterSuppression efforts.

I have already voted for @RepAlGreen's  impeachment resolutions, and now, reports that he urged the President of #Ukraine to investigate his political opponent only strengthen my conviction that Congress must act. It may be the only way to save our Democracy.

Just so we're clear -- I have supported an impeachment inquiry for some time because it has become increasingly obvious to me that this President has flagrantly abused the power of the Oval Office, without regard for the Constitution he swore to uphold and defend.

So pleased that @HouseDemocrats are working to pass the #NoBanAct, which I co-authored.

Read more about it here:  https://www.huffpost.com/entry/congress-muslim-ban-hearing_n_5d892984e4b0c2a85caf8658 … https://twitter.com/HouseJudiciary/status/1176497080988307456 …

I thank Terry for his nearly nine years of dedicated service to our community in this important role, and wish him and his family all the best in the months and the years ahead. https://twitter.com/indystar/status/1176229767256760320 …

So proud of the young people across America, and around the world, who are participating in today's #ClimateStrike. 

There is no Planet B, so it's vital we get serious about protecting the one we've got. I believe we can achieve that, with our kids leading the way.

As a member of @HouseIntel, I am determined to #FollowTheFacts and uncover the details of the whistleblower complaint. Americans deserve to know the truth. My full statement: pic.twitter.com/dkGOZTn92J

Proud to support this important bill to help keep our American aviation industry strong! https://twitter.com/TransportDems/status/1174689413244379136 …

Trump's @EPA wants to make it easier for polluters to dump harmful waste into our waters. This bad move could take us back to the days when our rivers were so dirty and toxic that they often caught on fire. Our leaders must value people over profits and #ProtectOurWater. pic.twitter.com/ZTUweixDLD

Great to meet with @Exodus_Refugee's Executive Director, Cole Varga, today in DC. I'm honored to work alongside this great organization to help Hoosiers and keep America's doors open to those in need. #RefugeesWelcome pic.twitter.com/dHeUwVWlyJ

This wonderful woman's story reminds us that the 9/11 attacks harmed people of many faiths. And it took people of many faiths to help America rebuild after that tragic day -- physically and spiritually. @JulieZauzmer https://wapo.st/2kcpq1v

Slavery's legacy looms large. This painful era lasted 246 years. But only 154 years have passed since it ended. And only 55 years since the Civil Rights Act outlawed Jim Crow segregation in practice. There is still so much work to be done to heal this wound on our nation's soul. pic.twitter.com/Mh93vj8Ni2

Thanks to @Alyssa_Milano, @HMAesq, @MorethanmySLE, and Peter's friend Charlie, for meeting with me today in DC. We discussed the vital need to #ProtectOurCare, stop the #Trump administration's cruel immigration agenda, and more. Keep up the excellent and inspiring work! pic.twitter.com/AWTLrGwFdc

Food Deserts are a public health emergency in our community and many others throughout America. We must remove the barriers to healthy, affordable groceries, and I'll soon introduce legislation that helps achieve that. Read more in the @IndyRecorder. https://bit.ly/2lGESmQ

Today, @RepRichHudson and I introduced the RARE Act, a bipartisan bill that helps @NIH and @CDCgov better study rare diseases, which afflict nearly 1 in 10 Americans. These reforms will help lead to more effective treatment, and pave the way to cures. https://bit.ly/2lGcPUU

#MaternalMortality is a public health emergency. I introduced w/ @RepLarryBucshon the Excellence in Maternal Health Act to help provide more critical maternal care. I will work hard to ensure that all Americans have the resources & information needed to #EndMaternalMortality.

#ThankYouAndrewLuck for giving your all to the @Colts, our city and all Hoosiers. We are incredibly grateful for the legacy you’ve created on and off the field by calling #Indy your home. May you always continue to push forward and inspire others!
It was an honor to start my morning with so many Indianapolis commuters on the @Indygo #RedLine pic.twitter.com/KRq7EwTbP0

Happy #LaborDay! America is strengthened by its workers, who have helped make this country the greatest in the world.
